description: Enterprise techniques used by Pisloader, ATT&CK software S0124 v1.1
name: Pisloader (S0124)

techniques.comment: [Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) uses DNS as its C2 protocol.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
[Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) establishes persistence via a Registry Run key.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
[Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) uses cmd.exe to set the Registry Run key value. It also has a command to spawn a command shell.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
Responses from the [Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) C2 server are base32-encoded.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
[Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) has commands to list drives on the victim machine and to list file information for a given directory.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
[Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) has a command to upload a file to the victim machine.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)

[Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) obfuscates files by splitting strings into smaller sub-strings and including "garbage" strings that are never used. The malware also uses return-oriented programming (ROP) technique and single-byte XOR to obfuscate data.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
[Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) has a command to collect victim system information, including the system name and OS version.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
[Pisloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0124) has a command to collect the victim's IP address.(Citation: Palo Alto DNS Requests)
